intro: Wendlandia densiflora, commonly known as the denseflower woollyflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woolly, hairy leaves and clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests at high elevations. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
